üö´ Toxic Plants for Cats

‚ö†Ô∏è If your cat comes into contact with these plants, seek veterinary care immediately!
‚ùå Highly toxic! Even small amounts can cause vomiting, kidney failure, or death
Plant NameCommon NameRisk Level
LilyLily‚ö†Ô∏è Extremely dangerous to cats! All parts (flowers, leaves, pollen, water) can cause acute kidney failure
OleanderOleanderCardiac toxin, even tiny amounts can be fatal
Sago PalmSago PalmSeeds are most toxic, can cause liver failure
TulipsTulipsBulbs are most toxic, cause drooling, seizures, irregular heartbeat
üö® Emergency: If your cat contacts any of these plants, contact your veterinarian or pet poison control immediately!
üê±
Aloe Vera
‚ö†Ô∏è
While aloe gel is safe for human use, the latex (yellow sap near the leaf skin) contains saponins and anthraquinones that are toxic to cats. Ingestion can cause vomiting, diarrhea, and lethargy.
Explore ‚Üí
üê±
Carnations
‚ö†Ô∏è
Carnations can cause mild gastrointestinal upset and skin irritation in cats. They‚Äôre not life-threatening, but best kept away from curious kitties.
Explore ‚Üí
üê±
Chrysanthemums
‚ö†Ô∏è
Chrysanthemums contain pyrethrins and sesquiterpene lactones that can cause vomiting, diarrhea, drooling, and even depression or incoordination in cats.
Explore ‚Üí
üê±
Daffodils
‚ö†Ô∏è
Beloved spring flowers that can irritate a cat‚Äôs mouth and GI tract. Bulbs contain the highest toxin concentration; petals and leaves are less toxic but still irritating.
Explore ‚Üí
üåø
üê±
Lilies
‚ö†Ô∏è
All parts of lilies are toxic to cats.
Explore ‚Üí
üê±
Monstera
‚ö†Ô∏è
Contains insoluble calcium oxalate crystals that cause intense burning and irritation of the mouth, tongue, and lips in cats. While rarely fatal, it causes significant discomfort.
Explore ‚Üí
üê±
Oleander
‚ùå
All parts contain cardiac glycosides extremely toxic to cats. Ingestion may cause severe heart problems, digestive upset, and can be fatal.
Explore ‚Üí
üê±
Peace Lily
‚ö†Ô∏è
Despite its name, the Peace Lily is NOT a true lily (Lilium) and does not cause kidney failure. However, it contains calcium oxalate crystals that irritate the mouth and digestive tract.
Explore ‚Üí
üê±
Philodendron
‚ö†Ô∏è
Contains insoluble calcium oxalate crystals that cause intense burning, drooling, and swelling in a cat‚Äôs mouth and throat. Rarely fatal, but ingestion is extremely uncomfortable.
Explore ‚Üí
üê±
Pothos
‚ö†Ô∏è
Contains calcium oxalate crystals that cause immediate burning and irritation in the mouth, lips, and tongue. Cats often chew it out of curiosity due to trailing vines‚Äîbut even a small bite causes distress.
Explore ‚Üí
üê±
Sago Palm
‚ùå
Every part is highly toxic to cats‚Äîseeds (nuts) are most deadly. Even a single seed can cause severe liver failure, seizures, and death within 24‚Äì48 hours.
Explore ‚Üí
üê±
Snake Plant
‚ö†Ô∏è
Snake plants contain saponins, which can cause nausea, vomiting, and diarrhea in cats. Most cases are mild, but ingestion should still be avoided.
Explore ‚Üí
üê±
Tulips
‚ùå
Tulips contain tulipalin A and B, which are most concentrated in the bulbs. Ingestion can cause drooling, vomiting, and diarrhea. Leaves and flowers are less toxic but still irritating.
Explore ‚Üí
üê±
ZZ Plant
‚ö†Ô∏è
Popular easy-care indoor plant containing calcium oxalate crystals that can cause oral irritation and GI upset if ingested by cats.
Explore ‚Üí
